intro: Psychotria pumila var. subumbellata, commonly known as the dwarf psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in understory habitats of tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
